item.source: Whats wrong with this yell command?

item.title: Whats wrong with this yell command?
item.dc:creator: @warxscape warxscape
item.description:
@warxscape wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:9, topic:528086”]You should use a loop for your master command, by the way. if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell") && c.playerRights > 0) { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client all = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[j]; String userTitle = ""; switch (c.playerRights) { case 1: userTitle = "@blu@Mod@bla@"; break; case 2: userTitle = "@blu@Admin@bla@"; break; case 3: userTitle = "@red@Owner@bla@"; break; case 4: userTitle = "@red@Donator@bla@"; break; default: userTitle = "@red@ERROR@bla@"; break; } if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("fishy")) { userTitle = "@red@#1 Staker@bla@"; } all.sendMessage("[" + userTitle + "]" + " " + c.playerName + ":" + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) + ""); } } } Your problem was that you never added brackets for the if statement under the switch statement.[/quote]

i still cant yell …

Read full topic
item.source: Whats wrong with this yell command?

item.title: Whats wrong with this yell command?
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

The dice has one problem, i will send you the fix in a minute
Edit;
if you didn’t noticed the dice command dont have a bracket (
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“dice”)) {
c.getItems().addItem(15084, 1);
)
So in the old commands pasteBin you send just add a bracket (
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“dice”)) {
c.getItems().addItem(15084, 1);
}

Read full topic
item.source: Whats wrong with this yell command?

item.title: Whats wrong with this yell command?
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

You should use a loop for your master command, by the way. if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell") && c.playerRights > 0) { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client all = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[j]; String userTitle = ""; switch (c.playerRights) { case 1: userTitle = "@blu@Mod@bla@"; break; case 2: userTitle = "@blu@Admin@bla@"; break; case 3: userTitle = "@red@Owner@bla@"; break; case 4: userTitle = "@red@Donator@bla@"; break; default: userTitle = "@red@ERROR@bla@"; break; } if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("fishy")) { userTitle = "@red@#1 Staker@bla@"; } all.sendMessage("[" + userTitle + "]" + " " + c.playerName + ":" + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) + ""); } } } Your problem was that you never added brackets for the if statement under the switch statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong with this yell command?
item.dc:creator: @warxscape warxscape
item.description:
@warxscape wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client all = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[j]; String userTitle = ""; switch (c.playerRights) { case 0: c.sendMessage("You have to be a Staff to use this feature..."); return; case 1: userTitle = "@blu@Mod@bla@"; break; case 2: userTitle = "@blu@Admin@bla@"; break; case 3: userTitle = "@red@Owner@bla@"; break; case 4: userTitle = "@red@Donator@bla@"; break; }

all of a sudden my yell command stop working for me(owner), whys this? whats wrong with the command?
